entry.def: The staff of an organization are the people who work for it.
entry.tran: (一组织的)全体工作人员，全体，职员

example.ex: The outpatient program has a staff of six people...
example.tran: 门诊部有 6 名工作人员。

entry.def: People who are part of a particular staff are often referred to as staff .
entry.tran: (全体工作人员中的)部分成员

example.ex: 10 staff were allocated to the task...
example.tran: 10名员工被分配来完成这项任务。

example.ex: He had the complete support of hospital staff.
example.tran: 他得到了医院职工的全力支持。

entry.def: If an organization is staffed by particular people, they are the people who work for it.
entry.tran: 由…担任工作人员;由…供职

example.tran: 它们的工作人员都是志愿者。

example.ex: The center is staffed with highly trained physicians...
example.tran: 该中心配备了训练有素的医生。

entry.def: A staff is a strong stick or pole.
A staff is the five lines that music is written on.

means.word_mean: 1. personnel who assist their superior in carrying out an assigned task;

sentences.sentence: "the hospital has an excellent nursing staff"
"the general relied on his staff to make routine decisions"

means.word_mean: 2. the body of teachers and administrators at a school;

sentences.sentence: "the dean addressed the letter to the entire staff of the university"

means.word_mean: 3. a strong rod or stick with a specialized utilitarian purpose;

sentences.sentence: "he walked with the help of a wooden staff"

means.word_mean: 4. building material consisting of plaster and hair; used to cover external surfaces of temporary structure (as at an exposition) or for decoration
5. a rod carried as a symbol
6. (music) the system of five horizontal lines on which the musical notes are written
